CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1951, pg. 2, reads: "Centenarian is Father to the 'nth Degree - George Howard, 708 Junilla Street (shown standing fourth from the left), celebrated his 100th birthday here recently. He was born May 29, 1851, in South Carolina.  With him were four sons, two grandsons, a granddaughter, and a great-great granddaughter.  All of hiss off-spring, except the great-great granddaughter, who is still a youngster, have children.  Left to right, standing: Charles Williams, William Howard, Charlie Howard, George Howard, Alta Howard, Arthur Williams and Walter Howard.  Seated are the grandmother, Mrs. Mamie Davis, holding the youngest of the clan, and Miss Willa Mae Davis. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Howard family, including seven standing men: Charles Williams, William Howard, Charlie Howard, centenarian George Howard, Alta Howard, Arthur Williams, Walter Howard; and two seated women:Mamie Davis holding baby, and Willa Mae Davis, posed in front of dark parted curtains, in Harris Studio
